list_definition.definition: a piece of ridiculous pretence which is so obvious that it does not deceive anyone

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Opposition parties have united to condemn the presidential election as a charade.

list_ex_of_english: I have never before spoken in a guillotine debate, because often they are charades, but this is a serious issue.
Starved of real investment, appalling at customer relations and only interested in the bottom line, our so-called "public" transport is now a charade.
The first is that they will not work and are a charade.
Rules should be established so that we shall no longer have to go through an endless game of charades every time extraditions are attempted.
Do not be misled by opinion polls or votes which in many ways are a charade.
We are not prepared to put up with this charade any longer.
We now have government by regulation, but let us consider another charade.
I believe that the country has already seen through that charade.
